title: Authors and Citation
text: Castillo L (2024). randMeasures: Tools analysis human random sequence generation.. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://lucas-castillo.github.io/randMeasures/, https://github.com/lucas-castillo/randMeasures.
code: @Manual{,   title = {randMeasures: Tools for analysis of human random sequence generation.},   author = {Lucas Castillo},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://lucas-castillo.github.io/randMeasures/},   url = {https://github.com/lucas-castillo/randMeasures}, }

what: Tools for analysis of human random sequence generation.
title: Tools for analysis of human random sequence generation.
text: goal randMeasures easily compute several measures human random sequence generation.

title: Tools for analysis of human random sequence generation.
text: can install development version randMeasures GitHub :

title: Get all measures — all_measures
text: s Sequence vector. Optional. Vector alternatives (e.g. 1:6 mental dice task).

title: Get all measures — all_measures
code: all_measures(sample(1:5, 100, T)) #>    redundancy repetitions adjacency turning_points coupon repetition_gap_med #> 1 0.002772021   0.1111111 0.3434343      0.6938776 11.375                  3 #>   repetition_gap_mean      RNG      RNG2 NSQ cluster_ratio phase_length_1 #> 1            4.789474 0.489644 0.5071958   0      2.416667      0.6865672 #>   phase_length_2 phase_length_3 phase_length_4 phase_length_5 fod_m5     fod_m4 #> 1      0.1940299       0.119403              0              0      0 0.05050505 #>      fod_m3    fod_m2    fod_m1     fod_0    fod_p1    fod_p2     fod_p3 #> 1 0.1010101 0.1414141 0.1414141 0.1111111 0.2020202 0.1212121 0.08080808 #>       fod_p4 fod_p5 #> 1 0.05050505      0

title: Redundancy — redundancy
text: s Sequence vector. Optional. Vector alternatives (e.g. 1:6 mental dice task).

title: Repetitions — repetitions
text: s Sequence vector. full Optional. Boolean.

title: Repetitions — repetitions
text: full returns vector length = length(s) whether ith item repetition last. Otherwise returns mean repetition rate.

title: Repetitions — repetitions
code: s <- sample(1:10, 100, T) repetitions(s) #> [1] 0.1515152 repetitions(s, full=T) #>   [1]    NA FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE #>  [13] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE #>  [25] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE #>  [37] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE #>  [49] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE #>  [61] FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE #>  [73] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE #>  [85] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE #>  [97]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE
